description:
From Middle English dirti, alteration of earlier dritti, equivalent to dirt +‎ -y. Cognate with Middle Low German drēterich (“dirty”).
See also drite.

entries.meaning: Unclean; covered with or containing unpleasant substances such as dirt or grime.
examples: Synonyms: filthy, soiled, sordid, unclean, unwashed; see also Thesaurus:unclean
Antonyms: clean; see also Thesaurus:clean

entries.meaning: That makes one unclean; corrupting, infecting.
examples: Don't put that in your mouth, dear. It's dirty.

entries.meaning: Morally unclean; obscene or indecent, especially sexually.
examples: Synonyms: indecent, lewd, obscene, raunchy, salacious
At the reception, Uncle Nick got drunk and told dirty jokes to the bridesmaids.

entries.meaning: Dishonourable; violating accepted standards or rules.
examples: Synonyms: cheating, foul, unsporting, unsportsmanlike
Antonym: sportsmanlike

entries.meaning: Corrupt, illegal, or improper.
examples: Synonyms: base, dishonest, dishonorable, filthy, despicable, lousy, mean, sordid, unethical, vile
I won't accept your dirty money!

entries.meaning: Out of tune.
examples: You need to tune that guitar: the G string sounds dirty.

entries.meaning: Of color, discolored by impurities.
examples: Synonyms: dingy, dullish, muddied, muddy
Antonyms: bright, pure
The old flag was a dirty white.

entries.meaning: (computing) Containing data needing to be written back to memory or disk.
examples: Occasionally it reads the sector into a dirty buffer, which means it needs to sync the dirty buffer first.

entries.meaning: (slang) Carrying illegal drugs among one's possessions or inside of one's bloodstream.
examples: None of y'all get into my car if you're dirty.

entries.meaning: (informal) Used as an intensifier, especially in conjunction with "great".
examples: He lives in a dirty great mansion.

entries.meaning: Sleety; gusty; stormy.
examples: Storms of wind, clouds of dust, an angry, dirty sea.

entries.meaning: (slang) Of an alcoholic beverage, especially a cocktail or mixed drink: served with the juice of olives.
examples: Antonym: neat
dirty martini

entries.meaning: Of food, indulgent in an unhealthy way.
examples: The waiter served dirty burgers to the customers.

entries.meaning: Spreading harmful radiation over a wide area.
examples: a dirty explosion
a dirty bomb

entries.meaning: (aviation) Having the undercarriage or flaps in the down position.
examples: Antonym: clean

adverbs.description: dirty (comparative more dirty, superlative most dirty)

entries.meaning: In a dirty manner.
examples: to play dirty
Synonyms: deceptively, dirtily, indecently, underhandedly

verbs.description: dirty (third-person singular simple present dirties, present participle dirtying, simple past and past participle dirtied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make (something) dirty.
examples: Synonyms: soil, taint; see also Thesaurus:dirty

entries.meaning: (transitive) To stain or tarnish (somebody) with dishonor.
examples: Synonym: sully

entries.meaning: (transitive) To debase by distorting the real nature of (something).
(intransitive) To become soiled.
